page.title: 01Area 03800267 by R.Nisbet
page.content: The region surveyed by us is in the mainly rural area of{The Wyre Forest {District,}bordering both sides of a stretch of the River Severn.{Stourport {on Severn}is the nearest town.The area is of mixed farming and fruit growing. Some farms grow soft fruits and vegetables for the "Pick your own" variety.Much wood land still abounds but some has given way to farm land and housing.The former took place in World War 2 and the latter were built post war.People commute from this area to many Midland cities.Village life is not what it was.Sub Post Offices and Village Stores have closed.Caravan sites and holiday chalets spring up alongside the river.The area has much to offer in the form of recreational pursuits,fishing and boating to name but two.
